body:
Right now FH is not a great item because it just make you WAY too vulnerable to true damage or magic damage. The mana also isn't necessarily the most useful thing ever because no one goes first item Frozen Heart.

Adding a Ruby Crystal to the build path and making it 3k gold would be perfect. So why not 3100g because that's how much a Ruby Crystal would make it worth? Simple, the time to farm it up is itself a deterrent and a cost. 3k gold is not cheap so delaying the spike by another 300g is already enough to make up for the 100g improved gold efficiency. This change would make it more attractive as a counter item without feeling totally useless vs other kinds of damage and with the buff to Cut Down as well as the proposed buffs to ADCs vs tanks, I think that's plenty enough to compensate.

Who actually goes FH without Resolve primary/secondary and any other HP tanky item like Adaptive Helm, Thornmail, Randuin's, Deadman's, Sunfire etc.? I've literally never seen a champion refuse to build an HP item with a full build and yet go FH. Plus, I'd still argue that the HP might be worth more than the Lord Dom bonus damage because you won't be attacked ONLY by the ADC in a game.
{{champion:28}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:267}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:43}} {{champion:37}} are a few examples
Also it has the attack speed aura, so it's good against literally any champion that builds attack speed.

It's fine in Transcendence builds, and MR+Health items are the norm. {{item:3065}} {{item:3194}} gives 800 health, and keep in mind the value of health lowers over the length of the game while armor and MR go up.

For any given health or resistance, the most gold value can be found from the formula [Health = 7.5 x Resistances +750] or [Resistances = (Health -750) / 7.5)

With just the normal two MR items or Visage + {{item:3068}}, most tanks will be well over 3000 health by time they're building FH. The 300 gold extra would largely go to waste since it's highly unlikely they'll be at 300 Armor with the heart. 

Frankly, just going even higher with the Armor by adding 300 gold worth of the stat would be a better buff.

Also remove slow resistance's/immunity's effect on Crippling.  Yi and Vayne %health true damaging through {{item:3110}} {{item:3075}} is ridiculous.
Take Randuin's Omen's active and put it on Frozen Heart, give Randuins a new active. Now it is viable as a true utility armor item and Randuins is less of a one stop shop item.

The problem is mana is too free right now, so it's not considered valuable when it should be. The short of it is I feel like yes the item is weak right now, but the problem is elsewhere. I say don't fix the symptoms, fix the problem, which is mana is too easy to come by.

I like to complain about Amumus mana problems, but realistically it's other champions that should share his problems, not that he should have the problem fixed.

The problem with fixing the symptom here, is that if you ever fix the problem, suddenly the symptoms you fixed become the problem. 400 mana should be a HUGE deal, but right now it isn't.

Let's go over who it's good for, people that max out a tear of the goddess item for synergy. Okay, now what champion that does that wants this anyway? I haven't seen Blitz in forever, but maybe he can still pull it off?

The thing is, even at that point now you want the mana for damage, cause you already have so much mana. Even then that's what 12AP/6AD? Not great, but better than a stat that does nothing I guess. Helps with Blitz shield too anyways.

If you add 150HP I'd say also reduce mana to 150 (but let's be realistic, it wouldn't matter cause a useless stat could have 1,000 or 0 and it's still useless, excluding mentioned synergies) So maybe -10 armor as well.

So yeah, I guess it's great on Blitz. It's effectively a +200 shield for 10 seconds. We should be careful with it unless we want blitz to get out of control again.
